title: JavaScript Fundamentals Quest
description: Test your knowledge of JavaScript fundamentals with this comprehensive quiz

questions.questionText: What is the correct way to declare a variable in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: In JavaScript, variables can be declared using var, let, or const keywords.

questions.questionText: Which symbol is used for single-line comments in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: // is used for single-line comments in JavaScript

questions.questionText: What will 'typeof null' return in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: This is a known quirk in JavaScript where typeof null returns 'object'

questions.questionText: Which method is used to add an element to the end of an array?
questions.explanation: push() adds one or more elements to the end of an array

questions.questionText: What does '===' operator do in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: === is the strict equality operator that checks both value and type

questions.questionText: Which keyword is used to define a function in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: The 'function' keyword is used to declare a function in JavaScript

questions.questionText: Which of the following is NOT a primitive data type in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: Array is an object type, not a primitive. Primitives are: string, number, boolean, null, undefined, symbol, bigint

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the 'this' keyword in JavaScript?
options: To refer to the current object
questions.explanation: 'this' refers to the object that is currently executing the code

questions.questionText: Which method is used to convert a string to lowercase?
questions.explanation: toLowerCase() is the correct method to convert strings to lowercase in JavaScript
